com.baasbox.android
Class BAASBox

java.lang.Object
  com.baasbox.android.BAASBox

public final class BAASBox
extends java.lang.Object

BAASBox is the main class that can be used to access all the functionalities the SDK offers. This class manage the authentication cycle through the login and signup requests and hold all the information needed to handle silent re-connection due an expired session token.
This version of the BAASBox SDK permits to manage the documents by creating, updating, deleting and retrieving their JSON data.

Every method of the class does not directly throw an exception or return the result, but it wraps the status of the method execution inside an instance of the class BAASBoxResult. If an exception has been thrown during the method execution, the subsequent request of the method BAASBoxResult.get() will throw that exception, if the method ended successfully, the plain result will be returned instead.

This structural choice has been made with the AsyncTask class specification in mind. The user can continue making an Android App in the same way he has always done; here's an example of how you could combine AsyncTask and BAASBox.

 public class GetDocumentTask extends
                AsyncTask<String, Void, BAASBoxResult<JSONObject>> {
 
        @Override
        protected BAASBoxResult<JSONObject> doInBackground(String... params) {
                String collection = params[0];
                String id = params[1];
 
                return box.getDocument(collection, id);
        }
 
        @Override
        protected void onPostExecute(BAASBoxResult<JSONObject> result) {
                try {
                        JSONObject obj = result.get();
                        onDocumentReceived(obj);
                } catch (BAASBoxInvalidSessionException e) {
                        showLoginActivity();
                } catch (BAASBoxException e) {
                        onError(e);
                }
        }
 }

Author:
Davide Caroselli

Method Detail

isNetworkAvailable

public boolean isNetworkAvailable()
Check if the network connectivity is available or not.

Returns:
true if and only if an active network connection is available, false otherwise.

isUserLoggedIn

public boolean isUserLoggedIn()
Check if the system has stored credentials. The method returns immediately, so it does not check if the credentials are still valid or not.

Returns:
true if the SDK has stored the user credentials, false otherwise.

signup

public BAASBoxResult<java.lang.Void> signup(java.lang.String username,
                                            java.lang.String password)
This method constructs a new JSONObject with username and password and return the result of the method signup(user).

signup

public BAASBoxResult<java.lang.Void> signup(java.lang.String username,
                                            java.lang.String password,
                                            JSONObject user)
This method overrides the username and password of the user passed as param and return the result of the method signup(user).

signup

public BAASBoxResult<java.lang.Void> signup(JSONObject user)
This method signup a new user. The JSONObject representing the user must have at least two string parameters: username and password (all in plain text).
After the method invocation a new user is signed in the App and it's connected to the SDK.

Parameters:
user - the JSON representing the user
Returns:
An empty result on success.

login

public BAASBoxResult<java.lang.Void> login(java.lang.String username,
                                           java.lang.String password)
Execute a login request with the given username and password. On success every previous credentials will be overwritten.

Parameters:
username - the username of the user.
password - the password in plain text.
Returns:
An empty result on success.

logout

public BAASBoxResult<java.lang.Void> logout()
Execute a logout request. On success the credentials of the user will be deleted.

Returns:
An empty result on success.

requestPasswordReset

public BAASBoxResult<java.lang.Void> requestPasswordReset(java.lang.String username)
Execute a password reset request for the given username.

Parameters:
username - the username of the user.
Returns:
An empty result on success.

changePassword

public BAASBoxResult<java.lang.Void> changePassword(java.lang.String oldPassword,
                                                    java.lang.String newPassword)
Changes the password of the current connected user. After this method invocation the SDK will override the internal stored credentials.

Parameters:
oldPassword - the old password in plain text
newPassword - the new password in plain text
Returns:
An empty result on success.

getUser

public BAASBoxResult<JSONObject> getUser()
Return the JSONObject from the server representing the current logged user.

Returns:
The user data from the server.

updateUser

public BAASBoxResult<java.lang.Void> updateUser(JSONObject user)
Updates the user info on the server. Be careful, all the data will be overwritten, not merged with the remote copy.

Parameters:
user - the new user data.
Returns:
An empty result on success.

createDocument

public BAASBoxResult<JSONObject> createDocument(java.lang.String collection,
                                                JSONObject document)
Creates a new document in the specified collection.

Parameters:
collection - the collection in which the document will be created.
document - the document data.
Returns:
The document as it has been created in the server, with a brand new id.

updateDocument

public BAASBoxResult<JSONObject> updateDocument(java.lang.String collection,
                                                java.lang.String id,
                                                JSONObject document)
Updates the document info on the server. Be careful, all the data will be overwritten, not merged with the remote copy.

Parameters:
collection - the collection in which the document is.
id - the id of the document.
document - the updated data of the document.
Returns:
The updated document itself.

getDocument

public BAASBoxResult<JSONObject> getDocument(java.lang.String collection,
                                             java.lang.String id)
Returns the document from the remote server.

Parameters:
collection - the collection in which the document is.
id - the id of the document.
Returns:
The document specified by the collection and the id.

deleteDocument

public BAASBoxResult<java.lang.Void> deleteDocument(java.lang.String collection,
                                                    java.lang.String id)
Removes the document from the collection and destroy all its data.

Parameters:
collection - the collection in which the document is.
id - the id of the document.
Returns:
An empty result on success.

Returns the count of the document that the user can read inside the given collection.

Parameters:
collection - the collection
Returns:
The count of the document that the user can read inside the given collection

getAllDocuments

public BAASBoxResult<JSONArray> getAllDocuments(java.lang.String collection)
Invokes getAllDocuments() with no where clause or pagination option. The result will contains all the documents of the given collection.

Parameters:
collection - the collection.
Returns:
A JSONArray of all the documents in the given collection.

getAllDocuments

public BAASBoxResult<JSONArray> getAllDocuments(java.lang.String collection,
                                                java.lang.String whereClause,
                                                java.lang.String... params)
Invokes getAllDocuments() with no pagination option. The result will contains all the documents of the given collection filtered by the where clause.
The user can set parameters in the where clause by using the ? char and the specify the actual value in the params array.

For example you can specify a where clause like color=? AND value=? and the parameters array like "blue", 15.

Parameters:
collection - the collection.
whereClause - the where clause in a SQL-alike syntax.
params - the parameters of the where clause.
Returns:
A JSONArray containing all the documents in the given collection filtered by the where clause.

getAllDocuments

public BAASBoxResult<JSONArray> getAllDocuments(java.lang.String collection,
                                                java.lang.String orderBy,
                                                int page,
                                                int recordPerPage)
Invokes getAllDocuments() with no where clause. The result will contains all the documents of the given collection starting from the index page * recordPerPage and limited at recordPerPage records count.

When using pagination an order by clause is mandatory.

Parameters:
collection - the collection
orderBy - the order by clause in a SQL-alike syntax
page - the number of the requested page.
recordPerPage - the size of each page.
Returns:
A JSONArray containing all the documents in the selected page.

getAllDocuments

public BAASBoxResult<JSONArray> getAllDocuments(java.lang.String collection,
                                                java.lang.String orderBy,
                                                int page,
                                                int recordPerPage,
                                                java.lang.String whereClause,
                                                java.lang.String... params)
Returns all the documents in a collection filtering by a where clause and ordering by a order by clause. The result is then divided into pages and only the requested page will be returned.
The user can set parameters in the where clause by using the ? char and the specify the actual value in the params array.

For example you can specify a where clause like color=? AND value=? and the parameters array like "blue", 15.

When using pagination an order by clause is mandatory.

Parameters:
collection - the collection.
orderBy - the order by clause, null if not used (when using pagination the order by clause is mandatory).
page - the selected page or -1 if no pagination is required.
recordPerPage - the size of each page.
whereClause - the where clause or null if not used.
params - the parameters value of the where clause.
Returns:
A JSONArray containing all the documents filtered and ordered according the method parameters.
